title: Wave properties - loudness speed and temperature

content.description: A machine generates sound waves in which the maximum increase and decrease in pressure from equilibrium is a fixed amount. The machine is operated on two separate days, one on which the air temperature is <math alttext="5 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> and another day on which the air temperature is <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>. How do the loudness of the sound and the speed of the sound waves compare for the two days?
content.question: Loudness of SoundSpeed of Sound WavesAThe same on both daysThe same on both daysBThe same on both daysFaster when the temperature is <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>CLouder when the temperature is <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>The same on both daysDLouder when the temperature is <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>Faster when the temperature is <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

topic.text: 14.1: Properties of Wave Pulses and Waves

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
